holidays.name: Festival of Sleep Day
holidays.description: A perfectly acceptable day dedicated to catching up on all the sleep you missed during the busy holiday season ‚Äî embrace naps, lazy lounging, and maybe even sleeping in past noon!
holidays.origin: Started by author W. T. Rabe in the 1990s as a humorous way to recognize the universal love of sleep and the need to rest after the holidays.
holidays.funFact: The Festival of Sleep Day coincides perfectly with many people's return to work, reminding us that deep rest is a revolutionary form of self-care.

holidays.name: Fruitcake Toss Day
holidays.description: A quirky day where people gather to toss their unwanted or infamous holiday fruitcakes as far as possible, turning a traditional doorstopper dessert into a hilarious sport!
holidays.origin: Began as a humorous tradition in Manitou Springs, Colorado, where residents turned the holiday fruitcake excess into an annual event in the 1980s.
holidays.funFact: Some fruitcakes used in these events have flown over 70 feet, demonstrating fruitcake's unexpected density and aerodynamic finesse.

holidays.name: Blood Donor Day (India)
holidays.description: A vital observance encouraging people in India to donate blood and save lives, highlighting the importance of voluntary blood donation.
holidays.origin: Established by health organizations in India to promote blood donation awareness and ensure adequate blood supply in hospitals.
holidays.funFact: India marks January 3 as Blood Donor Day to capitalize on the fresh resolve many have after New Year‚Äôs to make positive life-saving changes.

holidays.name: International Mind-Body Wellness Day
holidays.description: A wellness-focused day celebrating holistic health practices that unite mind, body, and spirit ‚Äî perfect for trying meditation, yoga, or mindful eating!
holidays.origin: Grew from modern holistic health movements emphasizing integrative approaches to well-being, gaining traction in the 2000s.
holidays.funFact: Practicing mind-body wellness even for 10 minutes on this day can significantly decrease stress hormones according to recent studies.
